386.description: Allows home schooled students to participate on an equal basis in extracurricular activities offered at the public school they would otherwise be required to attend.

388.title: Relating To Controversial Public School Curriculum.
388.description: Requires public schools to provide parents or legal guardians written advance notice of the instruction or provision of materials or activities that address controversial issues.

389.title: Relating To Selective Service.
389.description: Requires compliance with the Military Selective Service Act to be eligible for enrollment in a state-supported post-secondary institution, qualify for state financial assistance for post-secondary education, or be eligible for state or county employment or service. Provides exceptions. (HB422 HD1)

391.title: Relating To University Of Hawaii Rulemaking.
391.description: Substitutes the rulemaking requirements of Chapter 91, HRS, for the adoption of certain University of Hawaii policies with the open public meeting requirements of chapter 92, HRS. (HD1)

393.title: Relating To The Diamond Head State Monument.
393.description: Authorizes the issuance of general obligation bonds for the planning, design, and construction of a visitor and interpretive center at Diamond Head State Monument. Requires the department of land and natural resources to seek funds.

394.last_action: Re-referred to HHS/IAC, CPC, FIN, referral sheet 2
394.title: Relating To Gerontologist Licensing.
394.description: Establishes requirements for gerontologist licensure beginning on 7/1/2018.

395.title: Relating To The Elderly.
395.description: Makes financial exploitation of an elder by a caregiver a class A felony. Defines "caregiver", "elder", and "financial exploitation". Effective 7/1/2075. (SD1)

396.last_action: Re-referred to HHS, FIN, referral sheet 1
396.title: Relating To Care Facility Inspections.
396.description: Appropriates funds to the department of health for the posting of care facility inspection reports on the department's website.

397.last_action: Re-referred to HHS, FIN, referral sheet 2
397.title: Relating To Long-term Care.
397.description: Converts the Long-Term Care Community Living Program Specialist position within the Executive Office on Aging from exempt to permanent civil service status. (HB434 HD1)

398.last_action: Re-referred to HHS, JUD, referral sheet 2
398.title: Relating To Grandparents.
398.description: Allows the family court to award a grandparent, upon petition to the court, custody rights to a minor child, and establishes criteria to obtain such custody. Adds criteria regarding the award by the family court of grandparent visitation rights to a minor child. (HB435 HD1)

399.title: Relating To Propeller Guards.
399.description: Requires all motorized recreational vessels with an inboard/outboard motor or an outboard motor operating in nearshore waters to have properly functioning propeller guards. (HB436 HD1)

400.last_action: Received notice of discharge of conferees (Hse. Com. No. 385).
400.title: Relating To Coastal Zone Management.
400.description: Prohibits a waiver of a public hearing for action on a variance application for a shoreline hardening structure that will artificially fix the shoreline, including a seawall, revetment, or groin. Establishes findings the authority must make in determining whether a variance may be granted for a shoreline hardening structure that will artificially fix the shoreline. Takes effect on 7/1/2050. (SD2)

401.title: Relating To Commercial Marine Licenses.
401.description: Requires prospective commercial marine licensees to provide the Department of Land and Natural Resources with a copy of the work contract of all fishers that it employs under a foreign labor worker contract, prior to being granted a license. (HB438 HD1)

404.title: Relating To Minimum Wage.
404.description: Increases the state minimum wage rate incrementally each year to attain the rate of $22 per hour beginning 1/1/22. Authorizes the department of labor and industrial relations to annually adjust the minimum hourly wage beginning on 1/1/23 in accord with the Honolulu region consumer price index. Repeals the tip credit.

407.title: Proposing Amendments To Articles Ii, Iii, And Xvii Of The Hawaii State Constitution To Provide For Direct Initiative.
407.description: Proposes amendments to the state constitution to provide for direct adoption of state statutes and constitutional amendments by the electorate at a general election through an initiative process.

408.title: Relating To Conveyance Tax.
408.description: Reduces the conveyance tax rates for properties with a value of less than $1,000,000. Increases the conveyance tax rates for properties with a value of $2,000,000 or greater.

409.title: Making An Appropriation For A Diversified Agricultural Park.
409.description: Makes an appropriation for the acquisition of land, planning, design, and construction of an agricultural park in South Maui. (SD1)

411.title: Relating To Photovoltaic Solar Air Conditioning In Public Schools.
411.description: Requires the Department of Education to install photovoltaic solar air conditioning in all new public school facilities. Makes an appropriation.

413.last_action: Received notice of discharge of conferees (Hse. Com. No. 385).
413.title: Relating To Coral.
413.description: Requires UH to conduct a study on the effects of sunscreen on Hawaii's coral reefs and report to the Legislature. Appropriates funds. (SD1)

414.title: Relating To Agricultural Products.
414.description: Establishes an Organic Agricultural Products Voluntary Registry established by the Department of Agriculture. (HB452 HD1)

415.title: Relating To Invasive Species.
415.description: Authorizes departments that are members of the invasive species council to require landowners with land that contains invasive species to control or eradicate the invasive species if the landowner does not permit the department to enter the land. Imposes fines for noncompliance.

416.title: Relating To Agriculture.
416.description: Prohibits the Department of Agriculture from charging agricultural producers for the costs of food safety certification activities conducted by the department. (HB455 HD1)

418.title: Relating To The Community Court Outreach Project.
418.description: Establishes a community court outreach project in the City and County of Honolulu, subject to the availability of funds and memoranda of agreements from the Judiciary, Prosecuting Attorney, and the Public Defender. Appropriates funds. (HB457 HD1)

419.title: Relating To Identification.
419.description: Appropriates funds to issue civil identification cards to inmates upon request prior to their release from prison.

421.last_action: Received notice of discharge of conferees (Hse. Com. No. 385).
421.title: Relating To Resisting Arrest.
421.description: Creates the offense of resisting arrest in the first degree as a class C felony. Amends the existing resisting arrest misdemeanor offense to resisting arrest in the second degree. Takes effect on 1/7/2059. (SD1)

422.title: Relating To Correctional Facilities.
422.description: Requires the Department of Public Safety to solicit proposals for a new correctional facility. Requires new facility to be operated by public employees. Temporarily suspends the current EIS process for potential sites for the proposed Oahu Community Correctional Center. (HB462 HD2)

423.last_action: Received notice of discharge of conferees (Hse. Com. No. 385).
423.title: Relating To Hawaii State Identification Cards.
423.description: Allows any satellite city hall in any county with a population of more than seven hundred thousand persons to issue Hawaii state identification cards. Requires a report to the legislature. Takes effect on 1/7/2059. (SD1)

424.title: Relating To Bail.
424.description: Provides that no financial or property surety shall be required for bail in a case in which no felony is alleged. Provides that a person who commits a criminal offense while on bail for which no financial or property surety was required shall be guilty of a class C felony. (HB464 HD1)

425.title: Relating To The Boating Special Fund.
425.description: Repeals the boating special fund. Transfers unencumbered boating special fund moneys and future revenues to the general fund.

426.last_action: The committee(s) on FIN recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
426.title: Relating To Grants And Subsidies.
426.description: Authorizes expending agencies of grants, subsidies, and capital improvement project funds to delegate their expending authority to a different agency, subject to approval of the grantee and the Governor.

427.last_action: Re-referred to HHS, LAB, FIN, referral sheet 1
427.title: Relating To Collective Bargaining In Public Employment.
427.description: Creates 7 separate collective bargaining units for employees of the Hawaii Health Systems Corporation.

429.title: Relating To The Hawaii Health Systems Corporation.
429.description: Authorizes the Hawaii health systems corporation to enter into a contract for the privatization of food services at Hawaii health systems corporation facilities.

430.title: Related To Public Libraries.
430.description: Authorizes the Board of Education to contract for private groundskeeping services for public library properties. (HB470 HD1)

431.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The Benefit Of The Second Representative District.
431.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for the benefit of the 2nd Representative District.

432.title: Relating To United States Senator Daniel K. Inouye Day.
432.description: Establishes United States Senator Daniel K. Inouye Day on September 7 of each year.

433.last_action: Received notice of Senate conferees (Sen. Com. No. 831).
433.title: Relating To Rat Lungworm Disease.
433.description: Appropriates funds to the University of Hawaii at Hilo for testing, studies, outreach, research, and other activities related to the prevention and eradication of rat lungworm disease. (SD1)

434.title: Relating To Abuse Of Family Or Household Members.
434.description: Makes abuse of a family or household member who is younger than fourteen years of age a class C felony. (HB476 HD1)

435.title: Making An Appropriation To The Hawaii County Office Of The Prosecuting Attorney.
435.description: Makes an appropriation to the Office of the Prosecuting Attorney of the County of Hawaii for the Career Criminal Prosecution Unit, including the hiring of necessary staff. (HB477 HD1)

436.title: Making An Appropriation For Hiker Safety And Preparedness.
436.description: Appropriates funds from the Natural Area Reserve Fund to the DLNR for a public awareness campaign to educate the public about hiker safety and preparedness. (HB479 HD1)

439.title: Relating To The University Of Hawaii College Of Tropical Agriculture And Human Resources Cooperative Extension Service.
439.description: Appropriates funds to the UH college of tropical agriculture and human resources cooperative extension service for one full-time ornamental plant extension agent.

442.title: Relating To Irrigation.
442.description: Authorizes the director of finance to issue general obligation bonds to finance capital improvements to various irrigation systems.

443.title: Relating To The Mortgage Interest Deduction.
443.description: Eliminates the mortgage interest deduction for second homes under the Hawaii Income Tax Law. Specifies that the revenue gain attributable to this measure be deposited into the Rental Housing Revolving Fund. Requires the Department of Budget and Finance, in consultation with the Department of Taxation, to submit reports on the administration of this measure to the Legislature prior to the 2018, 2019, 2020, 2021, and 2022 Regular Sessions. (HB486 HD2)

446.title: Relating To Cesspools.
446.description: Requires DOH to develop guidelines for the mandatory disclosure of cesspools on real property.

447.title: Relating To Food Production.
447.description: Establishes and appropriates funding for the Food Production Goals Task Force.

448.title: Relating To Sidewalks.
448.description: Establishes and funds a two-year pilot school sidewalk maintenance and repair program that requires counties to maintain and repair sidewalks in school zones or other areas of significant school related pedestrian traffic. Requires each county to report on the status of the pilot program.

449.last_action: Received notice of discharge of conferees (Hse. Com. No. 385).
449.title: Relating To The Hawaii Teacher Standards Board.
449.description: Appropriates moneys from the general fund for two specialist II positions within the Hawaii Teacher Standards Board. Effective 7/1/2060. (SD1)

450.title: Relating To Charter Schools.
450.description: Appropriates moneys for start-up grants for newly approved, pre-opening public charter schools. (HB493 HD1)

451.title: Relating To Private Trade, Vocational, And Technical Schools.
451.description: Narrows the scope of the private trade, vocational, and technical school licensure program within the department of education. Establishes a licensing fee to ensure the sustainability of the licensure program. Establishes a license renewal process and fee. Creates the private trade, vocational, and technical school licensure special fund.

455.title: Relating To The Preschool Open Doors Program.
455.description: Clarifies the definition of "underserved" or "at-risk" children as it relates to the priority given to these children for the Preschool Open Doors program. Provides that priority among undeserved or at-risk children shall be given to children whose family income is at or below 250 per cent of the federal poverty level. Takes effect 7/1/2051. (SD1)

456.last_action: Received notice of discharge of conferees (Hse. Com. No. 385).
456.title: Relating To Public Prekindergarten Programs.
456.description: Authorizes the Executive Office on Early Learning and State Public Charter School Commission to enter into a memorandum of understanding to administer charter school prekindergarten classrooms. Appropriates moneys to continue funding of public prekindergarten classrooms. Effective 7/1/2051. (SD1)

458.title: Relating To Kaena Point.
458.description: Appropriates funds to the department of land and natural resources for additional enforcement officers and on-site educational staff for Kaena point state park and Kaena point natural area reserve to provide full-time coverage and monitoring.

461.title: Relating To Agricultural Commerce.
461.description: Repeals provision requiring counties to adopt ordinances regulating agricultural tourism as a precondition for allowing agricultural tourism activities in an agricultural district. Allows agricultural commerce, rather than agricultural tourism, in an agricultural district.

462.title: Relating To The Uniform Arbitration Act.
462.description: Authorizes the use of arbitration to resolve certain family law disputes. Specifies law applicable to arbitrations.

463.title: Relating To Athlete Agents.
463.description: Expands the definition of "athlete agent" (who shall register with the director of commerce and consumer affairs) to include individuals who, for compensation or the anticipation of compensation, serve a student athlete as a financial adviser or business manager. Requires reciprocity for athlete agents who are registered in more than one state. Strengthens requirements for athlete agent contracts. Strengthens requirements under which athlete agents shall notify the educational institution at which a student athlete is enrolled.

467.title: Relating To The Attorney General.
467.description: Requires the Attorney General to maintain records of hours spent on each lawsuit for disclosure to the public.

468.title: Relating To Indemnification.
468.description: Requires that if the attorney general defends against a civil action brought against a county for a negligent or wrongful act or omission by a county lifeguard who is designated to provide lifeguard services at a state beach park under an agreement between the State and that county, the State shall indemnify that county.

469.title: Proposing An Amendment To Article Iv, Section 2, Of The Hawaii State Constitution To Address The Selection Of Members Of The Reapportionment Commission.
469.description: Ensures participation of all political parties on the Reapportionment Commission by providing that if there are no members belonging to the minority party or parties in a house of the legislature, the members belonging to the same minority party or parties in the other house of the legislature shall nominate persons to serve on the Commission.

470.title: Relating To Seawater Air Conditioning.
470.description: Authorizes the issuance of general obligation bonds for seawater air conditioning facilities for certain state buildings in the Capitol District. (HB516 HD1)

474.title: Relating To University Of Hawaii Athletics.
474.description: Exempts from the Hawaii Public Procurement Code contracts by governmental bodies to procure goods or services for the Office of Intercollegiate Athletics of the University of Hawaii at Manoa with moneys from the University of Hawaii at Manoa Intercollegiate Athletics Special Fund. (HB520 HD1)

475.last_action: Received notice of discharge of conferees (Hse. Com. No. 385).
475.title: Relating To Business Development.
475.description: Establishes the high-growth grant program and special fund to provide grants to qualified businesses for certain business development activities. Makes appropriations. Effective 7/1/2038. (SD1)

476.title: Relating To Land Transfer.
476.description: Transfers title, custody, and control of two parcels of land identified as Tax Map Key No. 370120070000 and Tax Map Key No. 370040030000, from the State of Hawaii to the Hawaii Housing Finance and Development Corporation. (HB522 HD2)

478.last_action: Re-referred to HHS, JUD, referral sheet 2
478.title: Relating To Orders For Immediate Protection.
478.description: Requires a finding of substantial evidence that a vulnerable adult has incurred abuse or is in danger of abuse prior to the issuance of an order for immediate protection when the vulnerable adult is living at home with a prognosis of six months or less to live.

480.last_action: Received notice of discharge of conferees (Hse. Com. No. 385).
480.title: Relating To Mobile Clinics.
480.description: Appropriates funds to purchase, staff, and operate two mobile clinics to serve the homeless population. Takes effect on 7/1/2075. (SD2)

481.title: Relating To Political Signs.
481.description: Defines political signs. Fines candidate committees and noncandidate committees whose political signs are found on state property or highways.

482.title: Relating To Transportation Network Companies.
482.description: Allows the Director of Transportation to adopt rules to license and regulate transportation network company drivers operating at the airports.

483.title: Relating To Teacher Certification.
483.description: Provides an additional incentive option under the Department of Education's teacher national board certification incentive program for teachers who teach in their area of certification for at least two years at a Department school.

487.title: Relating To Law Enforcement.
487.description: Requires law enforcement agencies, including county police departments, to make personnel knowledgeable in the Law Enforcement Assisted Diversion (LEAD) approach. Requires law enforcement officers, including county police officers, to implement the LEAD approach.

488.last_action: Re-referred to HHS, FIN, referral sheet 1
488.title: Relating To Fowl.
488.description: Appropriates funds to the Department of Health to purchase traps for feral chickens and roosters and rent traps at a nominal fee to residents. Permits the Department of Health to contract with eligible non-profit or for-profit entities for that purpose.

489.last_action: Re-referred to HHS, JUD, referral sheet 2
489.title: Relating To Parking For Disabled Persons.
489.description: Requires parking placards for disabled persons to bear the disabled person's photograph and prominently display its expiration date. Establishes a penalty for using a placard after the death of the person to whom the placard was issued.

492.title: Relating To The Military.
492.description: Short form bill relating to the military.

495.title: Relating To The Arts.
495.description: Short form bill relating the arts.

496.title: Relating To International Affairs.
496.description: Short form bill relating international affairs.

500.last_action: Re-referred to HHS, JUD, referral sheet 1
500.title: Relating To Health-care.
500.description: Provides that an individual acting as agent, guardian, or surrogate regarding health-care decisions may be awarded damages upon prevailing in a civil action.

501.last_action: Re-referred to HHS, JUD, referral sheet 1
501.title: Relating To Advance Health-care Directives.
501.description: Clarifies the immunity of agents, surrogates, and guardians in making a health-care decision regarding a patient's advance health-care directive.

502.title: Relating To Death With Dignity.
502.description: Authorizes terminally ill adults seeking to end their life to request lethal doses of medication from medical and osteopathic physicians.

504.title: Relating To Criminal Defendants' Fitness To Proceed.
504.description: Provides that the court may appoint one qualified examiner instead of three, to evaluate a criminal defendant's fitness to proceed or regaining fitness to proceed in all penal cases and removes the requirement that examiner shall be from within the Department of Health. On July 1, 2022, the requirement shall be three qualified examiners for felony cases and one examiner in non-felony cases. One of the examiners shall be from within the Department of Health. (HB553 HD1)

505.title: Relating To Examinations Of Fitness To Proceed.
505.description: Clarifies provisions regarding examinations of defendants' fitness to proceed in the prosecution.

509.last_action: Re-referred to HHS/IAC, CPC, referral sheet 1
509.title: Relating To Dental Licensure.
509.description: Expands the required qualifications that applicants may fulfill as part of the requirements for dental licensure to include passage of other examinations substantively similar to ADEX and dental licensure in another state, along with other qualifications.

510.last_action: Re-referred to HHS, CPC, referral sheet 1
510.title: Relating To Dentistry.
510.description: Clarifies that a dentist who has not successfully completed the education specified for the dental specialty as defined by the American Dental Association may be subject to license suspension or revocation or a fine if the dentist uses words or phrases in advertising that are similar to the existing list of prohibited words or phrases. Expands the prohibited words or phrases to include "dentistry for children".

511.last_action: Re-referred to HHS/IAC, CPC, referral sheet 1
511.title: Relating To The Board Of Dentistry And Dental Hygiene.
511.description: Changes the name of the Board of Dental Examiners to the Board of Dentistry and Dental Hygiene (Board). Beginning on 7/1/2018, changes the Board composition by increasing dental hygienist representation and ensuring Oahu and neighbor island representation among dental hygienist members. Allows neighbor island Board members to attend meetings via teleconference. Requires the Board to develop conflict of interest policies for Board member participation with dental examination companies and to submit a report to the Legislature prior to the 2018 Regular Session on the status of the policy.

512.last_action: Re-referred to HHS/IAC, CPC, referral sheet 1
512.title: Relating To Dental Assistants.
512.description: Clarifies the allowable and prohibited practices and training requirements for dental assistants.

520.title: Relating To The Pacific International Space Center For Exploration Systems.
520.description: Provides that royalties from state land leases for basalt cinder and trap rock manufacturers shall be paid into the Basalt Materials Research Account within the Pacific International Space Center for Exploration Systems Special Fund. Sunsets December 31, 2030. (HB574 HD2)

522.last_action: The committee(s) on HHS recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
522.title: Relating To A Non-binding Referendum On Statewide Community Water Fluoridation.
522.description: Proposes a non-binding, statewide referendum on whether the State should pursue policies and programs for community water fluoridation in order to improve the overall dental health of Hawaii's children and adults.

523.last_action: Re-referred to HHS, EDN, FIN, referral sheet 2
523.title: Relating To Preschool Open Doors Program.
523.description: Expands the qualifying age for the preschool open doors program to children four years old and younger.

524.title: Relating To Social And Emotional Learning.
524.description: Requires the department of education to provide training on social and emotional learning to all youth-serving educators, health care professionals and counselors, and agencies and programs, as well as parents of students enrolled in public schools or public charter schools. Appropriates funds to the department of education to conduct training on social and emotional learning.

526.title: Relating To The Zero To Three Court.
526.description: Appropriates funds for staff positions and various services to support the Hawaii zero to three court. (HB581 HD1)

527.title: Relating To The Economy.
527.description: Short form bill relating to the economy.

528.last_action: Received notice of Senate conferees (Sen. Com. No. 804).
528.title: Relating To Technology.
528.description: Appropriates moneys to the Hawaii Technology Development Corporation for administrative and operational costs. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD1)

530.title: Relating To Cost Of Living.
530.description: Short form bill relating to cost of living.

532.last_action: Received notice of discharge of conferees (Hse. Com. No. 385).
532.title: Relating To Small Business.
532.description: Appropriates funds to the Department of Business, Economic Development, and Tourism to provide additional resources to the Small Business Regulatory Review Board. Effective 7/1/2060. (SD1)

533.last_action: Received notice of discharge of conferees (Hse. Com. No. 385).
533.title: Making An Appropriation For Heeia National Estuarine Research Reserve.
533.description: Appropriates funds for fiscal year 2018-2019 to maintain the initial staff positions that are necessary to develop and manage the Heeia National Estuarine Research Reserve and its programs. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD2)

535.title: Relating To The Creative Media Industry.
535.description: Establishes the Hawaii Creative Industries Advisory Group while retaining the Film Industry Branch and Creative Industries Division of DBEDT. Repeals the Hawaii Television and Film Development Board along with the grant and venture capital programs that were implemented by the Board. Renames the Hawaii Television and Film Development Special Fund as the Creative Media and Film Infrastructure Special Fund. Expands funding sources for the Creative Media and Film Infrastructure Special Fund to support creative industries development within DBEDT. Amends the purposes for which the Creative Media and Film Infrastructure Special Fund may be used. Provides general excise and use tax exemptions for operations and improvements of the Hawaii Film Studio. Requires the University of Hawaii and DBEDT to report to the legislature. Makes an appropriation. Effective 7/1/2038. (SD1)

537.title: Relating To Research Activities.
537.description: Provides that, notwithstanding provisions of the Internal Revenue Code to the contrary, the amount of the state tax credit for research activities shall be calculated based on all qualified research expenses for the taxable year. Appropriates funds for a compliance specialist position within DOTAX to assist with administration of the tax credit. (HB593 HD1)

538.title: Relating To The Maritime Industry Grant Program.
538.description: Establishes within the Department of Business, Economic Development, and Tourism the Maritime Industry Grant Program to enhance maritime productivity and workforce development. Takes effect 1/7/2059. (SD1)

539.last_action: Received notice of discharge of conferees (Hse. Com. No. 385).
539.title: Relating To The High Technology Development Corporation.
539.description: Appropriates funds to continue the Small Business Innovation Research Program within the High Technology Development Corporation. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD1)

540.title: Relating To Business Protection.
540.description: Broadens the scope of the Department of Business, Economic Development, and Tourism (DBEDT) to include business protection under its broad policy objectives. Requires DBEDT to gain an understanding of the functions and activities of other government agencies with respect to the field of business protection.

542.last_action: Received notice of discharge of conferees (Hse. Com. No. 385).
542.title: Relating To Cybersecurity.
542.description: Authorizes and provides funding for the University of Hawaii to participate in and contribute funding for the development of a Hawaii cyber ecosystem and related aspects of cyber security. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD1)

547.last_action: Re-referred to HHS, FIN, referral sheet 1
547.title: Relating To Landscaping.
547.description: Requires the department of agriculture, in consultation with the department of health, to create and maintain a list of plants and landscaping-related structures or equipment that are known to be preferred habitats for mosquito breeding and prohibits use of these elements in public landscaping. Exempts routinely maintained botanical gardens. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD1)

548.last_action: Re-referred to HHS, FIN, referral sheet 2
548.title: Relating To Aging.
548.description: Makes an appropriation to the Department of Health for the Kupuna Care Program. (HB608 HD1)

550.last_action: Re-referred to HHS, FIN, referral sheet 2
550.title: Making An Appropriation For The Office Of The Long-term Care Ombudsman Program.
550.description: Appropriates funds for the Long-Term Care Ombudsman Program to support the program on Oahu and for contracted services in the counties of Hawaii, Kauai, and Maui. (HB610 HD1)

551.last_action: Re-referred to HHS, FIN, referral sheet 2
551.title: Making An Appropriation For The Alzheimer's Disease And Related Dementia Services Coordinator Position.
551.description: Makes an appropriation for the Alzheimer's disease and related dementia services coordinator position. (HB611 HD1)

552.last_action: Re-referred to HHS, FIN, referral sheet 1
552.title: Making An Appropriation For The Aging And Disability Resource Center.
552.description: Appropriates funds for the Aging and Disability Resource Center. (HB612 HD1)

553.last_action: Re-referred to HHS, CPC, referral sheet 1
553.title: Relating To Hearing Aids.
553.description: Requires health insurance policies and contracts issued after 12/31/18 to provide coverage for the cost of hearing aids at a minimum of $1,500 per hearing aid for each hearing-impaired ear every thirty-six months.

554.last_action: Re-referred to HHS, FIN, referral sheet 1
554.title: Relating To Fall Prevention.
554.description: Appropriates funds to the Department of Health for one full-time equivalent Fall Prevention and Early Detection Coordinator position, which was established by Act 153, Session Laws of Hawaii 2014. (HB614 HD1)

556.title: Relating To Land Recordation.
556.description: Establishes the requirements that any plan of land for deregistered land must meet for recordation at the bureau of conveyances. Requires that any plan of land that involves deregistered land that is filed with the registrar of conveyances must be accompanied by data on the deregistration. (HB617 HD1)

557.title: Relating To Land Leases.
557.description: Sets a deadline for the transfer of certain non-agricultural park lands from the Department of Land and Natural Resources to the Department of Agriculture. (HB618 HD2)

558.title: Relating To Conservation And Resources Enforcement.
558.description: Re-establishes and revitalizes the DOCARE Volunteer Officer Program by recruiting and training new officers. Appropriates funds.

559.last_action: Received notice of discharge of conferees (Hse. Com. No. 385).
559.title: Relating To The Kahoolawe Island Reserve Commission.
559.description: Appropriates funds to support the Kahoolawe Island Reserve Commission. Takes effect 7/1/2050. (SD2)

560.title: Relating To Sustainability.
560.description: Establishes a three-year pilot project to promote photovoltaic powered desalinization on the island of Kahoolawe and to study certain aspects of the technology's use.

561.title: Relating To The Public Trust Land.
561.description: Authorizes the BLNR Chairperson to transfer public land trust funds to the Kahoolawe Rehabilitation Trust Fund. Authorizes the Office of Hawaiian Affairs to expend public land trust funds for purposes consistent with those of the Kahoolawe Rehabilitation Trust Fund. (HB622 HD1)

562.title: Relating To Broadband.
562.description: Establishes and funds a Broadband Coordinator position within the Department of Business, Economic Development, and Tourism, to develop the State of Hawaii Broadband Plan. Requires a report.

563.title: Relating To The Installation Of Infrastructure.
563.description: Clarifies the telecommunication exemptions to include small wireless and wireline facilities. Repeals and codifies in the Hawaii Revised Statutes provisions of Act 151, SLH 2011, that are permanent and general. Expands the definition of "wireless communications" antennas to include small wireless or wireline facilities. (HB624 HD1)

564.last_action: Received notice of discharge of conferees (Hse. Com. No. 385).
564.title: Relating To Infrastructure.
564.description: Establishes a collocation permitting, application, review and approval process for telecommunications companies proposing to install broadband infrastructure on solely state-owned or solely county-owned utility poles or light standards. Establishes the siting process. Takes effect on 5/22/2050. Applies to permit applications filed with the State or county after 1/1/2019. (SD2)

565.title: Relating To Urban Redevelopment.
565.description: Establishes the State Transit Oriented Development Authority. (HB626 HD1)

566.last_action: Received notice of discharge of conferees (Hse. Com. No. 385).
566.title: Relating To Statewide Infrastructure Capacity Building Construction Financing.
566.description: Establishes the Infrastructure Capacity Construction Loan Revolving Fund to provide loans to counties, state agencies, or private developers for infrastructure improvements. Appropriates funds. Effective 7/01/2050. (SD1)

568.title: Relating To Drought Mitigation.
568.description: Appropriates funds for county drought mitigation projects and measures. Appropriates funds for one full-time equivalent permanent planner IV position within the Commission on Water Resource Management to update the Hawaii drought plan. Effective 3/15/2099. (SD1)

569.title: Relating To Water.
569.description: Requires an owner or prior owner of an abandoned well to repair or seal the well at the owner's or prior owner's expense. Appropriates funds for three new positions to assist DLNR with the inspection of abandoned wells, the enforcement of well construction and pump installation standards, and enforcement of well abandonment requirements. (HB631 HD1)

570.title: Relating To The Issuance Of Special Purpose Revenue Bonds For The Nuuanu Hydroelectricity Project.
570.description: Authorizes the issuance of special purpose revenue bonds to assist the Board of Water Supply in upgrading Nuuanu reservoir #1 to meet state dam safety standards, as a component of the Nuuanu hydroelectricity project. (HB634 CD1)

572.last_action: Received notice of discharge of conferees (Hse. Com. No. 385).
572.title: Relating To Water Conservation.
572.description: Establishes a two-year water conservation financial assistance pilot program to provide financial assistance to county-owned public water systems. Appropriates funds. Effective 7/1/2050, repeals 6/30/19. (SD1)

573.title: Relating To The Department Of Land And Natural Resources.
573.description: Short form bill relating to the Department of Land and Natural Resources.

574.title: Relating To Land.
574.description: Short form bill relating to land.

579.title: Relating To New Market Tax Credits.
579.description: Expands methods for the delivery of funding to a project by providing loans to capitalize a qualified community development entity and provide guarantees or other credit enhancements to facilitate private lender participation in new markets tax credit financing. Increases total maximum funding amounts. (HB644 HD1)

584.title: Relating To Association Legal Fees.
584.description: Allows unit owners in planned community associations and condominium associations to withhold legal fees from assessments claimed by associations pending decision in any mediation, arbitration, or court proceeding in which the owner has filed for a determination of the validity of the amounts and attorney's fees claimed by the association. (HB649 HD1)

585.title: Relating To Real Property.
585.description: Sets 15-day time limit for fulfilling condo unit owner's requests for documents, etc. and requires access to the same by Internet download. Requires access to financial documents and association meeting minutes at manager's office on property and via email or mail. Subjects board members to breach of fiduciary duty for noncompliance. (HB650 HD1)

587.title: Relating To The Weed And Seed Strategy.
587.description: Appropriates funds as a grant-in-aid to the Honolulu Prosecuting Attorney to maintain and expand the weed and seed strategy, which is a collaborative effort to reclaim, restore, and rebuild communities. (HB653 HD1)

588.title: Relating To State And County Tort Liability.
588.description: Makes permanent an exemption from tort liability for the State and counties arising from lifeguard services, but not for gross negligence or wanton acts or omissions.

589.title: Relating To School Impact Fees.
589.description: Deletes school impact fee requirements for county and Hawaii Housing Finance and Development Corporation housing projects for low- and moderate-income individuals. Provides an exemption from school impact fees for housing developments constructed by nonprofit housing organizations in which the units are rented or sold to persons or families earning up to one hundred twenty per cent of the area median income. (HB656 HD1)

590.title: Relating To Mortgage Servicers.
590.description: Exempts nonprofit organizations and their employees from the licensing and regulations of mortgage servicers.

591.title: Relating To Lands Controlled By The State.
591.description: Authorizes the department of land and natural resources and the Hawaii community development authority to negotiate and execute ninety-nine year leases on the department's and authority's lands located within one-half mile of the city and county of Honolulu's planned rail transit stations, provided that affordable housing is included in the development plan for the lands to be leased. Sunsets on 6/30/50.

593.title: Relating To An Infrastructure Development Loan Revolving Fund.
593.description: Establishes the infrastructure development loan subaccount within the dwelling unit revolving fund to make loans to developers to finance the costs of the infrastructure of housing developments. Appropriates funds. Effective 7/1/2030. (SD1)

597.last_action: Re-referred to HHS, CPC, FIN, referral sheet 1
597.title: Relating To In Vitro Fertilization Insurance Coverage.
597.description: Removes discriminatory requirements for mandatory insurance coverage of in vitro fertilization procedures to create parity of coverage for same-sex couples, unmarried women, and male-female couples for whom male infertility is the relevant factor.

598.last_action: Re-referred to HHS, CPC, FIN, referral sheet 1
598.title: Relating To Victims Of Sexual Violence.
598.description: Requires health insurance coverage for case management services by licensed mental health providers for victims of sexual violence. (HB665 HD2)

599.last_action: Re-referred to HHS, JUD, referral sheet 1
599.title: Relating To Controlled Substances.
599.description: Limits initial prescriptions for opioids and benzodiazepines to a maximum of seven consecutive days.

601.title: Relating To Sexual Assault.
601.description: Provides certain rights to sexual assault survivors with regards to the testing of sexual assault evidence collection kits. Requires the Attorney General to provide the Legislature with an initial report prior to the 2018 Regular Session on law enforcement's progress to implement the guidelines for mandatory testing requirements. Thereafter, AG to provide the Legislature with annual reports of statistical data pertaining to the testing. (HB668 HD1)

602.title: Relating To Domestic Violence.
602.description: Streamlines the reporting requirements of the Department of Human Services (DHS)and the family courts to require DHS, upon direction of the court, to provide the family court with an oral or written report regarding the safety of a minor child of the parties on or prior to the next regularly scheduled court hearing. Provides that if DHS provides a written report, the DHS need not appear at the hearing unless ordered to do so. Requires the court to provide copies of all written reports to the parties. (HB669 HD1)

604.title: Relating To Equal Pay.
604.description: Prohibits enforced wage secrecy and retaliation or discrimination against employees who disclose, discuss, or inquire about their own or co-workers' wages.

605.last_action: Received notice of discharge of conferees (Hse. Com. No. 385).
605.title: Relating To School-based Health Services.
605.description: Formally establishes the Hawaii Keiki: Healthy and Ready to Learn Program within the Department of Education. Establishes a dedicated special fund and positions within the Departments of Education, Health, and Human Services to support the program. Makes appropriations. Effective 7/1/2090. (SD2)

606.last_action: Re-referred to HHS, FIN, referral sheet 2
606.title: Relating To Child Care Facilities.
606.description: Requires the Department of Human Services to post on its website, reports of child care facility inspections and corrective actions taken by the facility. Requires annual reporting to the Legislature on records and actions involving violation complaints. Appropriates funds. (HB673 HD1)

607.last_action: Re-referred to HHS, CPC, referral sheet 1
607.title: Relating To Contraceptive Supplies.
607.description: Authorizes pharmacists to prescribe and dispense self-administered hormonal contraceptive supplies to patients, regardless of a previous prescription from an authorized prescriber. Specifies requirements pharmacists must meet prior to prescribing and dispensing contraceptive supplies.

612.last_action: The committee(s) on CPH deleted the measure from the public hearing scheduled on 03-13-18 9:00AM in conference room 229.
612.title: Relating To Intimate Partner Violence.
612.description: Requires barber, beauty operator, and instructor licensees under the board of barbering and cosmetology to complete a one-time, three-hour training program on intimate partner violence awareness and education. (SD1)

614.title: Relating To Police Commissions.
614.description: Amends the composition of the county police commissions to require that three commissioners on each police commission have backgrounds, including equality for women, civil rights, and law enforcement, for the benefit of the public.

615.title: Relating To Public Employment.
615.description: Establishes a 6-week paid maternity and paternity leave policy for government employees to ensure that Hawaii's working families are adequately supported during times of needing to provide care to a newborn or bond with a new child.

617.title: Relating To Civil Actions.
617.description: Allows a civil action for recovery of damages to be brought by persons subjected to sexual offenses as a minor against the person who committed the act at any time by repealing the statute of limitations. Repeals the period during which a victim of child sexual abuse may bring an otherwise time-barred civil action against the victim's abuser or an entity with a duty of care, including the State and counties.

620.title: Proposing Amendments To Article Vii, Sections 12 And 13, Of The Constitution Of The State Of Hawaii Relating To Tax Increment Bonds.
620.description: Proposes amendments to the Constitution of the State of Hawaii to expressly provide that the legislature may authorize political subdivisions, such as counties, to issue tax increment bonds and to exclude tax increment bonds in calculating the debt limit of the political subdivisions.

621.title: Relating To Tax Increment Bonds.
621.description: Conforms county debt limit statements laws to include tax increment bonds if a constitutional amendment allowing the State to authorize the use of such bonds by the counties is ratified.

622.title: Relating To Income Tax Rates.
622.description: Decreases income tax rates by approximately 25 percent for all but the top income earners. Reinstates higher income tax brackets and rates similar to those that were repealed on 12/31/2015. (HB690 HD1)

623.title: Making Appropriations For The Veterans Treatment Court.
623.description: Appropriates funds to the Judiciary and the Prosecuting Attorney of the City and County of Honolulu to support the Veterans Treatment Court. (HB691 HD1)

624.last_action: Re-referred to HHS, FIN, referral sheet 2
624.title: Relating To Case Managers.
624.description: Authorizes Department of Human Services to negotiate reimbursement rate for case managers providing services to Medicaid patients. Specifies the percentage by which these reimbursement rates are to be increased.

625.last_action: Re-referred to HHS, FIN, referral sheet 2
625.title: Relating To Programs For High Risk Youth.
625.description: Appropriates funds to the Department of Human Services for the operational costs of an organization providing prevention, intervention, and group and individual counseling for high risk youth. Takes effect 1/1/2050. (SD1)

627.last_action: Re-referred to HHS, FIN, referral sheet 1
627.title: Relating To Home And Community-based Services.
627.description: Requires each licensed home and community-based case management agency to report to the Department on all referrals that were made by the agency, and to note in its report if any referral fee was paid to the agency, and the amount received for the referral. Requires the Department of Health to annually publish and revise a list of all licensed home and community-based case management agencies, including all information regarding referrals made to the agency and the amount paid to the agency for the referral, if any.

629.last_action: Re-referred to HHS, JUD, referral sheet 2
629.title: Relating To Family Courts.
629.description: In child custody and visitation proceedings involving an allegation or history of family violence: (1) requires family courts to first hold an evidentiary hearing on the issue of family violence; (2) requires child custody evaluators to have qualifications relevant to the subject of family violence; and (3) if the proceeding does not involve mental health issues, prohibits disqualification of a person for appointment as a child custody evaluator solely because the person does not hold a degree relating to mental health. Prohibits use of a parent's good faith allegation of family violence as a factor that weighs against the parent in determining child custody or visitation. Requires family court judges and professional personnel to complete ongoing training in the latest best practices and research in domestic violence advocacy.

633.title: Relating To Operating A Vehicle Under The Influence Of An Intoxicant.
633.description: Amends the definition of "drug" for Operating a Vehicle Under the Influence of an Intoxicant (OVUII) offenses under Chapter 291E, Hawaii Revised Statutes.

635.title: Relating To Forensic Identification.
635.description: Requires DNA samples from a felony offender regardless of whether the offender completed a criminal sentence, or was otherwise discharged from the jurisdiction of the court, for the qualifying felony offense prior to July 1, 2017.

636.title: Relating To Information Charging.
636.description: Amends the listing of felony offenses for which criminal charges may be instituted by written information.

639.title: Relating To Intoxicating Liquor.
639.description: Exempts the appointment and removal of an administrator of a liquor commission from civil service laws and requires the appointment to be subject to the advice and consent of the legislative body of the county. Allows the commission to issue a temporary license when the applicant or the transferor or transferee, in the case of a transfer of a license, is actively challenging a tax assessment, penalty, or other proceeding that prevents the issuance of a signed certificate from the appropriate federal or state tax agency. Limits the criminal history record check requirements for applicants of liquor licenses who are corporations or other entity to those persons with management or operational authority over the liquor-related operations. Allows, rather than requires, any investigator or other employee of the liquor commission to be represented and defended in any criminal or civil cause of action arising out of an action done as part of the investigator's or other employee's duty by certain specified counsel.

641.last_action: Re-referred to HHS, FIN, referral sheet 1
641.title: Relating To Health Care Coordination.
641.description: Appropriates $1,500,000 for the public-private partnership established for administrative purposes to implement a model of health care delivery in Maui county that addresses coordination of care in a seamless, efficient, appropriate, and cost-effective manner.

643.title: Relating To Absentee Voting.
643.description: Requires absentee ballots to be mailed not later than the closing of the polls on any election day and to be received by the clerk not later than three days following the closing of the polls on any election day.

644.title: Relating To Schools.
644.description: Allows a chief of police or police officer to be relieved of the responsibility to enforce certain department of education school and student security provisions.

647.title: Relating To Urban Agriculture.
647.description: Requires the counties to incorporate urban agriculture principles and policies in land use planning and to allow urban agriculture as a residential use in a residentially designated zone.

649.title: Relating To Notaries Public.
649.description: Prohibits a commissioned notary public from accepting a limited purpose driver's license for verification of identification. (HB717 HD1)

650.title: Relating To The Hawaii Housing Finance And Development Corporation.
650.description: Establishes an infrastructure program within the Hawaii housing finance and development corporation to make grants and provide assistance to counties for infrastructure projects on public land. Requires the executive director of the corporation to adopt rules pertaining to the application for and approval of grants.

651.title: Relating To The County Surcharge On State Tax.
651.description: Reduces the amount deducted from the county surcharge on state tax to reimburse the State for costs of assessment, collection, and disposition from 10% to 5%. Sunsets on December 31, 2027.

652.title: Relating To Smart Growth Development.
652.description: Establishes the state smart growth public infrastructure policy. Requires state agencies involved in the planning, development, and financing of public infrastructure to consider smart growth criteria prior to approving or financing any public infrastructure project and to either attest that the project meets smart growth criteria or prepare a statement of justification explaining why the project cannot meet smart growth criteria.

653.title: Relating To Public Transportation Incentives.
653.description: Establishes an income tax credit for taxpayers with an adjusted gross income of $100,000 or less who purchase bus passes or passes for a public transportation program. (HB721 HD1)

654.title: Relating To Solid Waste.
654.description: Establishes a pilot program to develop long-term environmental suitability strategies. Enables the HPHA to utilize private businesses to divert food and green waste from public housing projects. Requires HPHA to report to the Legislature. (HB722 HD1)

655.title: Relating To Highway Safety.
655.description: Increases the fines for violations of driving a motor vehicle at an excessive speed. (HB723 HD1)

660.title: Relating To Crosswalk Safety.
660.description: Clarifies when a pedestrian is crossing the roadway within a crosswalk for pedestrians' right-of-way in crosswalks and when a pedestrian is lawfully within an intersection or adjacent crosswalk for traffic control signal purposes.

661.title: Relating To Criminal History Record Checks.
661.description: Requires counties that regulate public passenger vehicle services to establish standards to protect passenger safety. Requires operators of public passenger vehicle services to provide a full set of electronic fingerprints and submit to a criminal history record check.

662.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The Benefit Of The Thirty-eighth Representative District.
662.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for the benefit of the 38th Representative District.

663.title: Relating To Liens.
663.description: Increases from 45 days to 90 days the time by which an application and notice for a mechanic's or materialman's lien must be filed after completion of applicable improvements. (HB732 HD1)

664.title: Relating To Bicycle Safety.
664.description: Specifies the minimum safe distance from a bicycle that a motor vehicle must maintain when overtaking the bicycle.

666.title: Relating To Motor Vehicle Registration.
666.description: Excepts direct import vehicles, i.e. vehicles at least 25 years old, from the requirement that vehicles be in compliance with all Federal Motor Vehicle Safety Standards to be registered. Defines "direct import vehicle."

667.title: Relating To Fuel Cell Electric Vehicles.
667.description: Includes fuel cell electric vehicles in the definition of "electric vehicles" for purposes of parking exemptions, HOV lane use, registration, and required parking spaces in places of public accommodation. Grants procurement priority for fuel cell electric vehicles for state and county vehicle purchases. (HB738 HD1)

672.title: Relating To Airports.
672.description: Short form bill relating to airports.

676.title: Relating To Pollution.
676.description: Repeals the law prohibiting the discharge of treated or raw sewage into state waters after December 31, 2026.

693.title: Relating To Public Land Leasing.
693.description: Requires the extension of public land leases to seventy-five years for affordable housing projects when Federal Housing Administration requirements need to be met for project funding.

694.title: Relating To The Auditor.
694.description: Authorizes the Auditor to receive and review confidential tax and other information. Allows the Auditor to report information necessary to explain and support its review and recommendations.

695.title: Related To Shipboard Gaming.
695.description: Establishes regulatory framework for licensed shipboard gaming in state waters. Makes an appropriation.

696.last_action: Re-referred to HHS, FIN, referral sheet 1
696.title: Relating To Prescriptive Authority For Certain Clinical Psychologists.
696.description: Authorizes and establishes procedures and criteria for prescriptive authority for clinical psychologists who meet specific education, training, and registration requirements. Requires the Board of Psychology to report to the Legislature prior to the Regular Session of 2021. (HB767 HD1)

697.title: Relating To Information Practices.
697.description: Allows the office of information practices to adopt rules that all state and county agencies subject to the Uniform Information Practices Act must follow for consistency in agency record protection responsibilities.

700.title: Relating To Highway Beautification And Disposal Of Abandoned Or Derelict Vehicles Revolving Fund.
700.description: Removes limits on the fees assessable by the counties for motor vehicle registration. Allows the counties to use the funds collected from such fees towards the beautification of highways and disposal of abandoned and derelict vehicles.

707.last_action: Re-referred to HHS, JUD, referral sheet 1
707.title: Relating To Vaccines.
707.description: Exempts from vaccination, revaccination, or immunization requirements of the Department of Health, any person who objects in writing to the requirements due to the person's philosophical beliefs. Replaces the Director of Health's discretion to overcome an individual's objection because of an epidemic with authority to order unvaccinated individuals to self-quarantine at home.

708.title: Relating To Nutrient Cycling.
708.description: Makes an appropriation for a regional nutrient cycling pilot program on Maui. Requires DOA to report on the efficacy of the pilot project.

709.title: Relating To The P-20 Agriculture Education Working Group.
709.description: Appropriates funds for the hiring of a coordinator and for interisland travel and operating expenses of the P-20 Agriculture Education Working Group within the University of Hawaii at Manoa College of Tropical Agriculture and Human Resources. Outlines the duties of the working group and opens participation in the working group to additional persons and entities.

710.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) DeCoite, Ing, Nakamura, Onishi, Woodson excused (5).
710.title: Relating To Health Care.
710.description: Appropriates funds to improve the health care services related to cardiac care at Kona Community Hospital. Funds may be used for the construction of a hybrid catheterization lab and operating room and funding of cardiology staff positions to alleviate the lack of cardiac care. Permits the Department of Health to hire physicians to serve as district health officers. (HB782 HD1)

712.title: Relating To Enterprise Zones.
712.description: Requires agricultural producers in an enterprise zone to have at least 50 percent of production to occur within the enterprise zones located within the same county. Extends the tax credit eligibility periods in enterprise zones for agricultural producers for an additional three years. (HB784 HD1)

713.title: Relating To The Hawaii Association Of Conservation Districts.
713.description: Makes an appropriation to the Department of Land and Natural Resources for the operational expenses and staffing costs of the Hawaii Association of Conservation Districts. (HB785 HD1)

715.title: Relating To Agricultural Land.
715.description: Permits private overnight campgrounds on land within agricultural districts in all counties, subject to specified conditions and adoption of appropriate county ordinances.

716.title: Relating To Solar Energy Facilities.
716.description: Requires solar energy facilities with a capacity of more than 15 kW in certain residential housing areas in agricultural districts to obtain a special use permit. (HB788 HD1)

717.title: Relating To Aquatic Habitats.
717.description: Authorizes the Department of Land and Natural Resources to use in-lieu fee mitigation to restore, create, enhance, or preserve aquatic habitats or resources as compensatory mitigation. Establishes an aquatic mitigation bank special fund and aquatic in-lieu fee mitigation special fund.

719.title: Relating To Natural Disaster Protection.
719.description: Establishes a 3-year parametric disaster insurance pilot program within DAGS to be funded by the interest from the hurricane reserve trust fund.

720.title: Relating To Electricity Generation.
720.description: Makes the use of customer self-supply facilities economically viable by requiring the Public Utilities Commission to develop standards and requirements to expedite the interconnection of qualifying customer self-supply facilities and allowing qualifying customers to select an applicable rate schedule.

721.title: Relating To Electric Vehicles.
721.description: Specifying that places of public accommodation with at least 100 parking spaces available for public use have at least one parking space designated for an electric vehicle per 100 parking spaces, subject to certain conditions. Removing the requirement allowing owners of multiple parking facilities to designate and electrify few parking spaces than required. Establishing notification requirements and fines for noncompliance. Establishing a task force to examine and make recommendations to expand electric vehicle parking spaces in public parking lots. (HB793 HD1)

722.title: Relating To Carbon Forestry Certification.
722.description: Appropriates funds for certification of a reforestation carbon project at Haleakala, Maui, operated by DLNR, under an established forest carbon standard certification system. Requires DLNR to submit an annual report on the project certification to the legislature. (HB795 HD1)

723.title: Relating To The Assault Of A Utility Worker.
723.description: Establishes a class C felony for an assault against a utility worker that causes serious or substantial bodily injury or an assault against a utility worker with a dangerous instrument that causes bodily injury. (HB796 HD1)

724.last_action: Re-referred to HHS, CPC, referral sheet 1
724.title: Relating To Pharmacists.
724.description: Authorizes pharmacies to dispense controlled substances, other than Schedule II substances, without an authorization to refill a prescription under limited conditions.

725.title: Relating To Vision Zero.
725.description: Requires DOT to implement a vision zero program in Hawaii by July 1, 2018.

726.title: Relating To Names.
726.description: Allows parties to a marriage or civil union to choose any middle or last name to use upon the marriage or civil union.

727.last_action: Re-referred to HHS, CPC, JUD, referral sheet 1
727.title: Relating To Minors.
727.description: Prohibits persons licensed to provide professional counseling from engaging in, attempting to engage in, or advertising sexual orientation change efforts on persons under eighteen years of age.

730.title: Relating To Ocean Waters.
730.description: Prohibits any person other than a law enforcement officer or lifeguard from operating a vessel within the ocean waters of Kailua Bay on Oahu within 750 feet of the shoreline at a speed in excess of slow-no-wake.

731.title: Relating To The Papahanaumokuakea Marine National Monument.
731.description: Establishes the Papahanaumokuakea Marine National Monument Program within DLNR-DAR to coordinate and fulfill the State's role and responsibilities in co-managing the Papahanaumokuakea Marine National Monument with federal authorities.

732.title: Relating To The Public Utilities Commission.
732.description: Establishes an intervenor compensation program to provide compensation to intervenors who make a substantial contribution to a Public Utilities Commission proceeding that produces a positive result or savings for consumers. Appropriates funds. (HB805 HD1)

733.title: Relating To Bullying.
733.description: Requires educational institutions and all youth-serving agencies to create and implement anti-bullying policies. Establishes a bullying prevention task force to provide guidance. Outlines the requirements for each institution or agency's policy and specifies reporting, investigation, and appeals procedures involving incidents of bullying. Provides immunity to reporters of bullying in the event of a cause of action for damages arising from the making of a report. Requires institutions and agencies to establish annual bullying prevention programs for youth and to provide bullying prevention training to all employees and volunteers who have significant contact with youth. Requires institutions and agencies to report aggregate figures regarding bullying to the governor and requires the governor to report to the legislature regarding bullying and the effectiveness of anti-bullying policies. Appropriates funds for anti-bullying and suicide prevention efforts in the public schools.

738.title: Relating To Salaries.
738.description: Repeals payroll day for public officers and employees by requiring them to be paid pursuant to a predicted payroll schedule, rather than an after-the-fact payroll schedule.

741.title: Relating To The Uniform Employee And Student Online Privacy Protection Act.
741.description: Adopts uniform laws on protecting the online accounts of employees and students from employers and educational institutions, respectively. (HB814 HD2)

742.title: Relating To Conservation.
742.description: Appropriates funds for a state civil service position to effectively track and monitor funds and expenditures related to habitat conservation plans and perform other tasks to benefit the recovery of threatened and endangered species.

743.title: Relating To Species Conservation.
743.description: Requires the Department of Land and Natural Resources to include in its annual report the impacts of incidental take license issuances on the status and likelihood of survival of the individual species and the cumulative impacts on the full range of species of the specific island for which incidental take licenses have been issued. Appropriates funds to the department to assess the cumulative effects and detail them in its annual report.

744.title: Relating To Marine Life Conservation.
744.description: Prohibits the use or application of sunscreen or sunblock containing oxybenzone or cosmetics with sunscreen containing oxybenzone while in a marine life conservation district.

745.title: Relating To Oxybenzone.
745.description: Bans the sale, offer for sale, or distribution for sale of sunscreen or personal care products containing oxybenzone. (HB818 HD2)

747.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The Benefit Of The Forty-eighth Representative District.
747.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for the benefit of the 48th Representative District.

748.title: Relating To Retail Wheeling.
748.description: Requires the public utilities commission to establish policies and procedures related to retail wheeling to enable independent power producers to sell electricity directly to end users.

750.title: Relating To Religious Rights.
750.description: Prohibits the State or any county from burdening any person's right to exercise religion absent that burden being the least restrictive means of furthering a compelling governmental interest.

754.title: Proposing Amendments To Article Vii, Sections 12 And 13, Of The Hawaii Constitution To Authorize The Counties To Issue Tax Increment Bonds And To Exclude Tax Increment Bonds From Determinations Of The Funded Debt Of The Counties.
754.description: Proposes amendments to the Constitution of the State of Hawaii to expressly provide that the Legislature may authorize political subdivisions, such as counties, to issue tax increment bonds and to exclude tax increment bonds in calculating the debt limit of the political subdivisions.

756.title: Relating To Public Housing.
756.description: Requires the Hawaii Public Housing Authority to document resident smoking violations observed by authority staff, agents, or authorized representatives and retain a record of violations on a resident's record for up to three years. (HB829 HD1)

757.title: Relating To Local Government.
757.description: Amends the county distribution of revenues collected from the transient accommodations tax. (HB830 HD1)

758.title: Relating To Public Works.
758.description: Increases from $500,000 to $5,000,000 the cost threshold for an experimental and demonstration housing developed by the counties or housing developed by the Hawaii Housing Finance and Development Corporation to be exempted from the wages and hours laws for public works.

760.last_action: Re-referred to HHS, FIN, referral sheet 1
760.title: Relating To A Diabetes Action Plan.
760.description: Requires DOH, in collaboration with DHS and DHRD, to develop a single, unified action plan to reduce the incidence of diabetes in the State and report to the legislature biennially on plan revisions, recommendations for legislative action, and updated information on areas of need, costs, and resources required for continued implementation of the plan.

761.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The Benefit Of The Fourth Representative District.
761.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for the benefit of the 4th Representative District.

764.title: Relating To Water Security.
764.description: Amends the two-year pilot program in the Department of Land and Natural Resources that enables public-private partnerships to provide funds for projects that increase water security. (HB838 HD1)

767.last_action: Re-referred to AGR, HHS, EDN, referral sheet 1
767.title: Relating To The Health Impact Of Pesticides.
767.description: Establishes buffer zones around schools that restrict pesticide use by any entity or person.

768.last_action: Re-referred to HHS, FIN, referral sheet 2
768.title: Relating To Dental Health.
768.description: Appropriates funds to the Department of Human Services to restore basic adult dental benefits to Medicaid enrollees. Requires the Department of Human Services to obtain the maximum federal matching funds available for the expenditure. (HB843 HD1)

769.last_action: Received notice of discharge of conferees (Hse. Com. No. 385).
769.title: Relating To Youth.
769.description: Requires the Office of Youth Services to coordinate a two-year Safe Places for Youth Pilot Program in partnership with private organizations to coordinate a network that youth can access for safety and where youth can obtain advice, guidance, programs, and services. Establishes a Safe Places for Youth Pilot Program Coordinator position. Requires a report to the Legislature. Appropriates funds. (SD1)

770.title: Relating To The Chairperson Of The Hawaiian Homes Commission.
770.description: Amends the membership of the commission on water resource management to add the chairperson of the Hawaiian homes commission or the chairperson's designee to serve as an ex officio voting member.

771.last_action: Received notice of discharge of conferees (Hse. Com. No. 385).
771.title: Relating To Energy Modernization At The University Of Hawaii System.
771.description: Requires UH to develop a microgrid plan for one demonstration project at any property on Oahu owned, leased, or controlled by UH. Authorizes UH to select the location for the project. Requires UH to collaborate with the local electric utility. Requires quarterly status reports to the legislature. Requires UH to submit the microgrid plan to the legislature prior to the regular session of 2019. Defines "microgrid". Effective 7/1/2050. (SD2)

772.title: Relating To Appropriations For The Honolulu Family Justice Center.
772.description: Appropriates funds to the Department of the Prosecuting Attorney of the City and County of Honolulu for the Honolulu Family Justice Center. Requires the City and County of Honolulu to provide matching funds on a 1:1 basis.

773.title: Relating To Legal Services.
773.description: Makes an appropriation to the judiciary to purchase civil legal services for low- and moderate-income persons.

774.title: Relating To Mobile Electronic Devices.
774.description: Authorizes drivers to use streaming music services through mobile electronic devices while driving.

775.title: Relating To Online Fantasy Sports.
775.description: Establishes an online fantasy sports contests registration and monitoring program under the department of the attorney general. Exempts registered online fantasy sports contests from state gambling laws. Appropriates funds to the department of the attorney general to establish and implement a registration and monitoring program for online fantasy sports contests.

778.title: Relating To Motor Vehicle Driver Licensing.
778.description: Prohibits agency sharing of documents and information containing citizenship and other biographical information collected from a person applying for a limited purpose driver's license, limited purpose provisional driver's license, or limited purpose instruction permit.

779.title: Relating To Teacher Salaries.
779.description: Sets a salary schedule for entry-level, mid-level, and senior-level teachers in public schools.

780.last_action: Received notice of appointment of House conferees (Hse. Com. No. 609).
780.title: Relating To Actions For Quiet Title.
780.description: Provides that where a quiet title action involves kuleana land, at the request of any defendant at the time the action was brought, the court shall order: mandatory mediation with a goal of resolving the dispute, including any issues that might need to be preliminarily established through an action commenced under chapter 668A; and consolidation of separate actions commenced by the same plaintiff or multiple plaintiffs for the same real property in interest. Requires the plaintiff in a quiet title action involving kuleana land to bear the costs of required mediation and only recover costs, expenses, or attorney's fees from the defendant as the court may deem equitable under the circumstances. Takes effect 7/1/2035. (SD1)

781.title: Relating To Community-based Subsistence Fishing Areas.
781.description: Requires DLNR to adopt rules for a community-based subsistence fishing area within two years of receipt of a proposal. Establishes annual reporting requirement. Effective 7/1/2030. (SD1)

782.title: Relating To Training.
782.description: Requires state and county department heads to take the training on native Hawaiian and Hawaiian traditional and customary rights administered by OHA.

784.title: Relating To Coral Reef Protection.
784.description: Bans the sale, offer for sale, or distribution for sale of sunscreen or personal care products containing oxybenzone. Effective July 1, 2018.

786.title: Relating To Agricultural And Aquacultural Building Permits.
786.description: Repeals the changes made to agricultural and aquacultural building permit requirements in Act 203, SLH 2013, to ensure that Hawaii's communities are not suspended from participation in the NFIP.

787.title: Relating To The Hawaii Community Development Authority.
787.description: Establishes Transit-Oriented Development Community Districts within the Hawaii Community Development Authority (HCDA) to develop districts along certain rail stations in the Honolulu rail station transit corridor. Allows the HCDA to enter into public-private partnerships for a lease-back arrangement of lands.

790.title: Relating To Mortgages.
790.description: Clarifies that a co-mortgagor assisting a qualified resident in securing a mortgage to purchase a dwelling unit from the Hawaii housing finance and development corporation may be a family member, which also includes extended or hanai family members. Requires a qualified resident who is assisted by a co-mortgager to have an income of at least fifty per cent of the amount required to qualify for a loan to purchase the dwelling unit. (HB870 HD1)

791.title: Relating To Public Utilities.
791.description: Prohibits electric utilities from installing power connections or transferring accounts or services without owner or legal occupant consent. (HB871 HD1)

792.title: Relating To Chapter 302d, Hawaii Revised Statutes.
792.description: Requires that the appropriation made to the Public Charter School Commission be apportioned to other authorizers. Requires that authorizers meet similar governance requirements as the Public Charter School Commission.

793.title: Relating To Sustainable Living.
793.description: Establishes a permit that exempts sustainable living research and sites from certain county codes, ordinances, and rules. Effective 7/1/2038. (HD1)

795.title: Relating To Historic Preservation.
795.description: Appropriates funds for 5 full-time equivalent (5.00 FTE) temporary student intern II positions within the state historic preservation division. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD1)

796.title: Relating To Broadband Communications.
796.description: Short form bill relating to broadband communications.

797.title: Relating To Commerce.
797.description: Short form bill relating to commerce.

799.title: Relating To Property Insurance.
799.description: Short form bill relating to property insurance.

802.title: Relating To General Excise Taxes.
802.description: Exempts amounts received from sales of food and over-the-counter drugs from the general excise tax.

804.title: Relating To Delay In Prior Approval For Medical Services.
804.description: Prohibits health insurance preauthorization requirements that cause undue delay in receipt of medical treatment or services. Specifies that insurers, but not health care providers, are liable for civil damages caused by undue delays for preauthorization. (HB885 HD1)

805.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Souki excused (1).
805.title: Relating To Filipino Veterans.
805.description: Requires and funds the Office of Veterans' Services to establish a Filipino Veterans Legacy Exhibit at the Daniel K. Inouye International Airport. (HB886 HD1)

806.title: Relating To Unfunded Liabilities.
806.description: Establishes the Rate Stabilization Reserve Fund within the Hawaii Employer-Union Health Benefits Trust Fund to help subsidize the costs of providing health and other benefit plans for active employees and retirees and their beneficiaries. Caps employer contributions to the OPEB trust fund, which are made to prefund the unfunded actuarial accrued liability of the EUTF, when the separate accounts for each public employer within the OPEB trust fund have a combined balance of at least $2,000,000,000. If OPEB trust fund balance is at least $2,000,000,000 then public employer annual contributions of $300,000,000 shall be paid to the Employees' Retirement System to pay down ERS unfunded liabilities. Provides for the use of a portion of transient accommodations tax revenues to supplement deficient county public employer contribution amounts. (HB887 HD1)

807.title: Relating To Addressing The Health Unfunded Liability.
807.description: Requires the LRB to study the feasibility of providing health benefits to state and county employees using a self-insured model. Makes an appropriation. (HB888 HD1)

811.title: Relating To Molokai High School Athletics.
